text: Castle of Magical Dreams is the new centerpiece castle that replaced Sleeping Beauty Castle at Hong Kong Disneyland in late 2020, as part of the park's 15th anniversary celebration. The castle was redesigned to pay tribute to 13 Disney Princess and heroines, Including Snow White, Rapunzel, Tiana, Aurora, Merida, Anna and Elsa, Jasmine, Mulan, Pocahontas, Belle, Ariel, Cinderella, and Moana. The castle also features a brand new Bibbidi-Bobbidi Boutique, at the location of the Storybook Shoppe, which has debuted before the completion of the castle in 2019. It is the third attraction to open as part of the park’s multi-year expansion from 2018 to 2023. However, it was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the park's second closure. ==History== On November 22, 2016, the Walt Disney Company and the Hong Kong Government announced plans for a multi-year, HK$10.9 billion expansion of Hong Kong Disneyland. The proposed expansion includes Arendelle: World of Frozen, Stark Expo, multiple new attractions, and live entertainment. Hong Kong Disneyland Resort revealed creative details about the upcoming castle transformation — an important part of the park’s ongoing multiyear expansion plan on 8 December 2017. ==See also== * Sleeping Beauty Castle * Cinderella Castle * Le Château de la Belle au Bois Dormant * Enchanted Storybook Castle ==References== Category:Amusement rides introduced in 2020 Category:Hong Kong Disneyland Category:Fantasyland Category:Disney Princess Category:Walt Disney Parks and Resorts icons Category:2020 establishments in Hong Kong
title: Castle of Magical Dreams
